New Records: Fernando Tatis Jr. is one shy of the NLDS record for most home runs in a series, held by Carlos Beltran (2004, Houston) and Nick Castellanos (2023, Philadelphia)
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr.'s towering two-run home run highlighted a six-run second inning
Teoscar Hern√°ndez hit a grand slam with one out in the third off Michael King
Mookie Betts also homered for the Dodgers to break an 0-for-22 playoff slump
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts said the Dodgers will go with a bullpen game on Wednesday night
The Padres will start RHP Dylan Cease on short rest
Post-Match Reflections: Fernando Tatis Jr. said he feeds off the crowd's energy
Manager Mike Shildt said Tatis 'likes it' and 'he's one of the many guys on our team that appreciates and enjoys bright lights and embraces it'
Freddie Freeman said the Dodgers fought back after coming back from a six-run deficit
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of a record crowd of 47,744 at Petco Park
Mookie Betts' first playoff hit since Game 3 of the 2022 NLDS against San Diego was a home run
Walker Buehler missed the 2023 season after undergoing a second Tommy John surgery in August 2022
